attributes.action: Government to confirm there are no plans to introduce blasphemy laws into the UK
attributes.additional_details:
During Prime Ministers questions on
Wednesday 27 November questions were put to the PM by members of his own party that were clearly intended to commit the PM to introduce blasphemy laws. The PM failed to confirm or deny whether this would happen
Criticism of religion of any denomination is a fundamental right of freedom of speech. There is no reason why religion should be exempt from criticism.
attributes.background: I want the Government to make it clear through a formal statement in Parliament that they have no plans to introduce blasphemy laws into the UK.

rejection.details:
The Government have said that they are not going to introduce blasphemy laws:
https://hansard.parliament.uk/Commons/2024-12-18/debates/ba455fa1-fb15-4e1b-b4c9-884dfdaeb83e/CommonsChamber#contribution-83E4227E-B766-4980-9AFC-A77C90D20A59

We can also only accept petitions from people who provide their full name.
